Class fileReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • fileReader

  • public class fileReader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a reader that redirects STD I/O to current directory and reads/writes files in current directory.
    It allows you to read files by name and extension. Supports .txt, .htm, etc but not .pdf
    It allows you to to use Strings in the files and perform different operations on them.
    It allows you to print treated data into .txt files

    Recommended use: to scan HTML files for key-element: img src for example.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Osama Askoura
    Follow on Twitter
    Project on Github
    Cairobox Portfolio

    • Constructor Detail

      • fileReader

        public fileReader(java.lang.String name,
          java.lang.String extension)
        Constructs a reader that looks in current directory for the given file name. It also populates a list and set with the read lines infile. Note: It skips empty lines. trims and lowerCase() all un-empty lines.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of file in current directory to read
        extension - The extension of file. e.g: "txt" or "htm"

    • Method Detail

      • getSet

        public java.util.Set getSet()
        Returns a LinkedHashSet of non-duplicated lines in the read file.
        Returns:
        LinkedHashSet of String type.

      • getList

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getList()
        Returns LinkedList of read lines in files. Note: the linkedlist allow duplicates.
        Returns:
        Linked List of all read lines.

      • getTokens

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getTokens(java.lang.String delimiter)
        Returns a LinkedList of String tokens delimited by the given delimiter.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - Split words/tokens by this string.
        Returns:
        Linked List of all words separated by the delimiter in type String.

      • initiateStream

        public int initiateStream(java.lang.String name)
        Instantiate a PrintStream to the current directory with the given filename.
        Parameters:
        name - filename of .txt file to print into.
        Returns:
        ID of the .txt file in current folder for further use.

      • print

        public void print(int streamID,
         java.lang.String feed)
        Prints/Writes a String s to a .txt file by the given ID.
        Parameters:
        streamNumber - the unique ID of the file produced when instantiating the stream.
        s - the string to print into file.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes all PrintStreams created/instantiated. *Recommended at the end of your main method.
